issue.title: Opening Qube Settings Fails Critically When Application Refreshes Interrupted

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: default
labels.description: Priority: default. Default priority for new issues, to be replaced given sufficient information.

labels.name: diagnosed
labels.description: Technical diagnosis has been performed (see issue comments).

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### Qubes OS release
4.1.1




### Brief summary
If the refresh of applications of a Qube is interrupted (e.g. a sudden power loss) while it is in progress, attempting to open the settings of a Qube fails with a critical error related to the execution of `qvm-appmenus`. 
Below is the resulting error for a Qube called 'yubico'.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58621925/181877311-4f62b013-af1b-412a-8d7a-8dc0dee82cf6.png)


This is caused by having `.desktop` files stored in that Qube's `apps.template` directory in Dom0 which are incomplete (e.g. don't have a name value).  Them being incomplete causes the `qvm-appmenus` command to fail. 

The exact behaviour is further elaborated in the 'Actual Behaviour' section below.


### Steps to reproduce
While this bug will only be caused by events which produce a sudden interruption of either the machine as a whole or the refresh applications feature, **it can be triggered manually.**

The issue being caused by non-complete `.desktop` files you can reproduce the error in the following way:
1. Open the terminal emulator in Dom0
2. Navigate to `~/.local/share/qubes-appmenus/QUBENAME/apps.template/`, replacing `QUBENAME` by the name of the Qube you want to test this out on.
3. Create a blank `.desktop` file (i.e. `touch test.desktop`).
4. Navigate to the Qube app menu and attempt to open the Qube settings for your Qube `QUBENAME`. 
5. This should trigger an identical crash.
6. **To trigger directly in the terminal with more details**, you can run the `qvm-appmenus` command listed which should be `qvm-appmenus --get-available QUBENAME --i-understand-format-is-unstable --file-filed QUBENAME`. However, you can also trigger the error with a much shorter version of the command: `qvm-appmenus --get-available QUBENAME --i-understand-format-is-unstable`

To then remove the error, simply delete the blank `.desktop` file created earlier (i.e. `test.desktop`).



### Expected behavior
Still been able to access the settings and even the 'Applications' tab, displaying the error inside the actual tab (e.g. overlaying the application list) nonetheless allowing users to be able to refresh the applications of their Qube directly through the GUI.
There could also be a benefit towards only having the complete application listing occur when the applications tab of that Qube's settings are opened, reducing unnecessary resource usage on each opening of a Qube's settings since far from every opening of a Qube's settings will see a user going to the 'Applications' tab.




### Actual behavior
The behaviour of the `qvm-appmenu` command listed above is that once it comes across a `.desktop` file which is incomplete, it exits with an error. 
This would not be a particular issue if it was not for the refresh applications feature creating `.desktop` files before actually populating them. 
When my system suddenly crashed while I was in the process of refreshing applications for one of my Qubes, when resolving the issue manually afterwards by deleting all of the blank `.desktop` files, I realised that I had been left with numerous blank `.desktop` files. They were all I believe new applications that were not previously listed in the application menu but nonetheless, there were multiple which were completely blank.

This behaviour from the applications refresh leaving multiple `.desktop` files as completely empty will then cause an issue in the listing of available applications performed by the `qvm-appmenus` file.

issue.title: `qvm-appmenus --remove` on dispvm templates leads to `xdg-desktop-menu` error

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: default
labels.description: Priority: default. Default priority for new issues, to be replaced given sufficient information.

labels.name: diagnosed
labels.description: Technical diagnosis has been performed (see issue comments).

labels.name: pr submitted
labels.description: A pull request has been submitted for this issue.

issue.body:
### Qubes OS release

R4.1 (4.1.1)

### Brief summary

`qvm-appmenus --remove` on dispvm templates errors out on a `xdg-desktop-menu` call.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a new AppVM, say `test-dvm`
2. `qvm-prefs test-dvm template_for_dispvms true`
3. `qvm-features test-dvm appmenus-dispvm 1`
4. `qvm-appmenus --create test-dvm`
5. `qvm-appmenus --remove test-dvm`

### Expected behavior

Appmenus for `test-dvm` are created and removed without errors.

### Actual behavior

Appmenus removal errors out:

```
xdg-desktop-menu: desktop-file argument missing
Try 'xdg-desktop-menu --help' for more information.
Problem removing appmenus for test-dvm
```

issue.title: Opening Qube Settings Fails Critically When Application Refreshes Interrupted

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: default
labels.description: Priority: default. Default priority for new issues, to be replaced given sufficient information.

labels.name: diagnosed
labels.description: Technical diagnosis has been performed (see issue comments).

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### Qubes OS release
4.1.1




### Brief summary
If the refresh of applications of a Qube is interrupted (e.g. a sudden power loss) while it is in progress, attempting to open the settings of a Qube fails with a critical error related to the execution of `qvm-appmenus`. 
Below is the resulting error for a Qube called 'yubico'.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58621925/181877311-4f62b013-af1b-412a-8d7a-8dc0dee82cf6.png)


This is caused by having `.desktop` files stored in that Qube's `apps.template` directory in Dom0 which are incomplete (e.g. don't have a name value).  Them being incomplete causes the `qvm-appmenus` command to fail. 

The exact behaviour is further elaborated in the 'Actual Behaviour' section below.


### Steps to reproduce
While this bug will only be caused by events which produce a sudden interruption of either the machine as a whole or the refresh applications feature, **it can be triggered manually.**

The issue being caused by non-complete `.desktop` files you can reproduce the error in the following way:
1. Open the terminal emulator in Dom0
2. Navigate to `~/.local/share/qubes-appmenus/QUBENAME/apps.template/`, replacing `QUBENAME` by the name of the Qube you want to test this out on.
3. Create a blank `.desktop` file (i.e. `touch test.desktop`).
4. Navigate to the Qube app menu and attempt to open the Qube settings for your Qube `QUBENAME`. 
5. This should trigger an identical crash.
6. **To trigger directly in the terminal with more details**, you can run the `qvm-appmenus` command listed which should be `qvm-appmenus --get-available QUBENAME --i-understand-format-is-unstable --file-filed QUBENAME`. However, you can also trigger the error with a much shorter version of the command: `qvm-appmenus --get-available QUBENAME --i-understand-format-is-unstable`

To then remove the error, simply delete the blank `.desktop` file created earlier (i.e. `test.desktop`).



### Expected behavior
Still been able to access the settings and even the 'Applications' tab, displaying the error inside the actual tab (e.g. overlaying the application list) nonetheless allowing users to be able to refresh the applications of their Qube directly through the GUI.
There could also be a benefit towards only having the complete application listing occur when the applications tab of that Qube's settings are opened, reducing unnecessary resource usage on each opening of a Qube's settings since far from every opening of a Qube's settings will see a user going to the 'Applications' tab.




### Actual behavior
The behaviour of the `qvm-appmenu` command listed above is that once it comes across a `.desktop` file which is incomplete, it exits with an error. 
This would not be a particular issue if it was not for the refresh applications feature creating `.desktop` files before actually populating them. 
When my system suddenly crashed while I was in the process of refreshing applications for one of my Qubes, when resolving the issue manually afterwards by deleting all of the blank `.desktop` files, I realised that I had been left with numerous blank `.desktop` files. They were all I believe new applications that were not previously listed in the application menu but nonetheless, there were multiple which were completely blank.

This behaviour from the applications refresh leaving multiple `.desktop` files as completely empty will then cause an issue in the listing of available applications performed by the `qvm-appmenus` file.

issue.title: Opening Qube Settings Fails Critically When Application Refreshes Interrupted

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: default
labels.description: Priority: default. Default priority for new issues, to be replaced given sufficient information.

labels.name: diagnosed
labels.description: Technical diagnosis has been performed (see issue comments).

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### Qubes OS release
4.1.1




### Brief summary
If the refresh of applications of a Qube is interrupted (e.g. a sudden power loss) while it is in progress, attempting to open the settings of a Qube fails with a critical error related to the execution of `qvm-appmenus`. 
Below is the resulting error for a Qube called 'yubico'.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58621925/181877311-4f62b013-af1b-412a-8d7a-8dc0dee82cf6.png)


This is caused by having `.desktop` files stored in that Qube's `apps.template` directory in Dom0 which are incomplete (e.g. don't have a name value).  Them being incomplete causes the `qvm-appmenus` command to fail. 

The exact behaviour is further elaborated in the 'Actual Behaviour' section below.


### Steps to reproduce
While this bug will only be caused by events which produce a sudden interruption of either the machine as a whole or the refresh applications feature, **it can be triggered manually.**

The issue being caused by non-complete `.desktop` files you can reproduce the error in the following way:
1. Open the terminal emulator in Dom0
2. Navigate to `~/.local/share/qubes-appmenus/QUBENAME/apps.template/`, replacing `QUBENAME` by the name of the Qube you want to test this out on.
3. Create a blank `.desktop` file (i.e. `touch test.desktop`).
4. Navigate to the Qube app menu and attempt to open the Qube settings for your Qube `QUBENAME`. 
5. This should trigger an identical crash.
6. **To trigger directly in the terminal with more details**, you can run the `qvm-appmenus` command listed which should be `qvm-appmenus --get-available QUBENAME --i-understand-format-is-unstable --file-filed QUBENAME`. However, you can also trigger the error with a much shorter version of the command: `qvm-appmenus --get-available QUBENAME --i-understand-format-is-unstable`

To then remove the error, simply delete the blank `.desktop` file created earlier (i.e. `test.desktop`).



### Expected behavior
Still been able to access the settings and even the 'Applications' tab, displaying the error inside the actual tab (e.g. overlaying the application list) nonetheless allowing users to be able to refresh the applications of their Qube directly through the GUI.
There could also be a benefit towards only having the complete application listing occur when the applications tab of that Qube's settings are opened, reducing unnecessary resource usage on each opening of a Qube's settings since far from every opening of a Qube's settings will see a user going to the 'Applications' tab.




### Actual behavior
The behaviour of the `qvm-appmenu` command listed above is that once it comes across a `.desktop` file which is incomplete, it exits with an error. 
This would not be a particular issue if it was not for the refresh applications feature creating `.desktop` files before actually populating them. 
When my system suddenly crashed while I was in the process of refreshing applications for one of my Qubes, when resolving the issue manually afterwards by deleting all of the blank `.desktop` files, I realised that I had been left with numerous blank `.desktop` files. They were all I believe new applications that were not previously listed in the application menu but nonetheless, there were multiple which were completely blank.

This behaviour from the applications refresh leaving multiple `.desktop` files as completely empty will then cause an issue in the listing of available applications performed by the `qvm-appmenus` file.

issue.title: Opening Qube Settings Fails Critically When Application Refreshes Interrupted

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: default
labels.description: Priority: default. Default priority for new issues, to be replaced given sufficient information.

labels.name: diagnosed
labels.description: Technical diagnosis has been performed (see issue comments).

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### Qubes OS release
4.1.1




### Brief summary
If the refresh of applications of a Qube is interrupted (e.g. a sudden power loss) while it is in progress, attempting to open the settings of a Qube fails with a critical error related to the execution of `qvm-appmenus`. 
Below is the resulting error for a Qube called 'yubico'.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58621925/181877311-4f62b013-af1b-412a-8d7a-8dc0dee82cf6.png)


This is caused by having `.desktop` files stored in that Qube's `apps.template` directory in Dom0 which are incomplete (e.g. don't have a name value).  Them being incomplete causes the `qvm-appmenus` command to fail. 

The exact behaviour is further elaborated in the 'Actual Behaviour' section below.


### Steps to reproduce
While this bug will only be caused by events which produce a sudden interruption of either the machine as a whole or the refresh applications feature, **it can be triggered manually.**

The issue being caused by non-complete `.desktop` files you can reproduce the error in the following way:
1. Open the terminal emulator in Dom0
2. Navigate to `~/.local/share/qubes-appmenus/QUBENAME/apps.template/`, replacing `QUBENAME` by the name of the Qube you want to test this out on.
3. Create a blank `.desktop` file (i.e. `touch test.desktop`).
4. Navigate to the Qube app menu and attempt to open the Qube settings for your Qube `QUBENAME`. 
5. This should trigger an identical crash.
6. **To trigger directly in the terminal with more details**, you can run the `qvm-appmenus` command listed which should be `qvm-appmenus --get-available QUBENAME --i-understand-format-is-unstable --file-filed QUBENAME`. However, you can also trigger the error with a much shorter version of the command: `qvm-appmenus --get-available QUBENAME --i-understand-format-is-unstable`

To then remove the error, simply delete the blank `.desktop` file created earlier (i.e. `test.desktop`).



### Expected behavior
Still been able to access the settings and even the 'Applications' tab, displaying the error inside the actual tab (e.g. overlaying the application list) nonetheless allowing users to be able to refresh the applications of their Qube directly through the GUI.
There could also be a benefit towards only having the complete application listing occur when the applications tab of that Qube's settings are opened, reducing unnecessary resource usage on each opening of a Qube's settings since far from every opening of a Qube's settings will see a user going to the 'Applications' tab.




### Actual behavior
The behaviour of the `qvm-appmenu` command listed above is that once it comes across a `.desktop` file which is incomplete, it exits with an error. 
This would not be a particular issue if it was not for the refresh applications feature creating `.desktop` files before actually populating them. 
When my system suddenly crashed while I was in the process of refreshing applications for one of my Qubes, when resolving the issue manually afterwards by deleting all of the blank `.desktop` files, I realised that I had been left with numerous blank `.desktop` files. They were all I believe new applications that were not previously listed in the application menu but nonetheless, there were multiple which were completely blank.

This behaviour from the applications refresh leaving multiple `.desktop` files as completely empty will then cause an issue in the listing of available applications performed by the `qvm-appmenus` file.

issue.title: `qvm-appmenus --remove` on dispvm templates leads to `xdg-desktop-menu` error

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: default
labels.description: Priority: default. Default priority for new issues, to be replaced given sufficient information.

labels.name: diagnosed
labels.description: Technical diagnosis has been performed (see issue comments).

labels.name: pr submitted
labels.description: A pull request has been submitted for this issue.

issue.body:
### Qubes OS release

R4.1 (4.1.1)

### Brief summary

`qvm-appmenus --remove` on dispvm templates errors out on a `xdg-desktop-menu` call.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a new AppVM, say `test-dvm`
2. `qvm-prefs test-dvm template_for_dispvms true`
3. `qvm-features test-dvm appmenus-dispvm 1`
4. `qvm-appmenus --create test-dvm`
5. `qvm-appmenus --remove test-dvm`

### Expected behavior

Appmenus for `test-dvm` are created and removed without errors.

### Actual behavior

Appmenus removal errors out:

```
xdg-desktop-menu: desktop-file argument missing
Try 'xdg-desktop-menu --help' for more information.
Problem removing appmenus for test-dvm
```

issue.title: Opening Qube Settings Fails Critically When Application Refreshes Interrupted

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: default
labels.description: Priority: default. Default priority for new issues, to be replaced given sufficient information.

labels.name: diagnosed
labels.description: Technical diagnosis has been performed (see issue comments).

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### Qubes OS release
4.1.1




### Brief summary
If the refresh of applications of a Qube is interrupted (e.g. a sudden power loss) while it is in progress, attempting to open the settings of a Qube fails with a critical error related to the execution of `qvm-appmenus`. 
Below is the resulting error for a Qube called 'yubico'.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58621925/181877311-4f62b013-af1b-412a-8d7a-8dc0dee82cf6.png)


This is caused by having `.desktop` files stored in that Qube's `apps.template` directory in Dom0 which are incomplete (e.g. don't have a name value).  Them being incomplete causes the `qvm-appmenus` command to fail. 

The exact behaviour is further elaborated in the 'Actual Behaviour' section below.


### Steps to reproduce
While this bug will only be caused by events which produce a sudden interruption of either the machine as a whole or the refresh applications feature, **it can be triggered manually.**

The issue being caused by non-complete `.desktop` files you can reproduce the error in the following way:
1. Open the terminal emulator in Dom0
2. Navigate to `~/.local/share/qubes-appmenus/QUBENAME/apps.template/`, replacing `QUBENAME` by the name of the Qube you want to test this out on.
3. Create a blank `.desktop` file (i.e. `touch test.desktop`).
4. Navigate to the Qube app menu and attempt to open the Qube settings for your Qube `QUBENAME`. 
5. This should trigger an identical crash.
6. **To trigger directly in the terminal with more details**, you can run the `qvm-appmenus` command listed which should be `qvm-appmenus --get-available QUBENAME --i-understand-format-is-unstable --file-filed QUBENAME`. However, you can also trigger the error with a much shorter version of the command: `qvm-appmenus --get-available QUBENAME --i-understand-format-is-unstable`

To then remove the error, simply delete the blank `.desktop` file created earlier (i.e. `test.desktop`).



### Expected behavior
Still been able to access the settings and even the 'Applications' tab, displaying the error inside the actual tab (e.g. overlaying the application list) nonetheless allowing users to be able to refresh the applications of their Qube directly through the GUI.
There could also be a benefit towards only having the complete application listing occur when the applications tab of that Qube's settings are opened, reducing unnecessary resource usage on each opening of a Qube's settings since far from every opening of a Qube's settings will see a user going to the 'Applications' tab.




### Actual behavior
The behaviour of the `qvm-appmenu` command listed above is that once it comes across a `.desktop` file which is incomplete, it exits with an error. 
This would not be a particular issue if it was not for the refresh applications feature creating `.desktop` files before actually populating them. 
When my system suddenly crashed while I was in the process of refreshing applications for one of my Qubes, when resolving the issue manually afterwards by deleting all of the blank `.desktop` files, I realised that I had been left with numerous blank `.desktop` files. They were all I believe new applications that were not previously listed in the application menu but nonetheless, there were multiple which were completely blank.

This behaviour from the applications refresh leaving multiple `.desktop` files as completely empty will then cause an issue in the listing of available applications performed by the `qvm-appmenus` file.

issue.title: `qvm-appmenus --remove` on dispvm templates leads to `xdg-desktop-menu` error

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: default
labels.description: Priority: default. Default priority for new issues, to be replaced given sufficient information.

labels.name: diagnosed
labels.description: Technical diagnosis has been performed (see issue comments).

labels.name: pr submitted
labels.description: A pull request has been submitted for this issue.

issue.body:
### Qubes OS release

R4.1 (4.1.1)

### Brief summary

`qvm-appmenus --remove` on dispvm templates errors out on a `xdg-desktop-menu` call.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a new AppVM, say `test-dvm`
2. `qvm-prefs test-dvm template_for_dispvms true`
3. `qvm-features test-dvm appmenus-dispvm 1`
4. `qvm-appmenus --create test-dvm`
5. `qvm-appmenus --remove test-dvm`

### Expected behavior

Appmenus for `test-dvm` are created and removed without errors.

### Actual behavior

Appmenus removal errors out:

```
xdg-desktop-menu: desktop-file argument missing
Try 'xdg-desktop-menu --help' for more information.
Problem removing appmenus for test-dvm
```

issue.title: Opening Qube Settings Fails Critically When Application Refreshes Interrupted

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: default
labels.description: Priority: default. Default priority for new issues, to be replaced given sufficient information.

labels.name: diagnosed
labels.description: Technical diagnosis has been performed (see issue comments).

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### Qubes OS release
4.1.1




### Brief summary
If the refresh of applications of a Qube is interrupted (e.g. a sudden power loss) while it is in progress, attempting to open the settings of a Qube fails with a critical error related to the execution of `qvm-appmenus`. 
Below is the resulting error for a Qube called 'yubico'.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58621925/181877311-4f62b013-af1b-412a-8d7a-8dc0dee82cf6.png)


This is caused by having `.desktop` files stored in that Qube's `apps.template` directory in Dom0 which are incomplete (e.g. don't have a name value).  Them being incomplete causes the `qvm-appmenus` command to fail. 

The exact behaviour is further elaborated in the 'Actual Behaviour' section below.


### Steps to reproduce
While this bug will only be caused by events which produce a sudden interruption of either the machine as a whole or the refresh applications feature, **it can be triggered manually.**

The issue being caused by non-complete `.desktop` files you can reproduce the error in the following way:
1. Open the terminal emulator in Dom0
2. Navigate to `~/.local/share/qubes-appmenus/QUBENAME/apps.template/`, replacing `QUBENAME` by the name of the Qube you want to test this out on.
3. Create a blank `.desktop` file (i.e. `touch test.desktop`).
4. Navigate to the Qube app menu and attempt to open the Qube settings for your Qube `QUBENAME`. 
5. This should trigger an identical crash.
6. **To trigger directly in the terminal with more details**, you can run the `qvm-appmenus` command listed which should be `qvm-appmenus --get-available QUBENAME --i-understand-format-is-unstable --file-filed QUBENAME`. However, you can also trigger the error with a much shorter version of the command: `qvm-appmenus --get-available QUBENAME --i-understand-format-is-unstable`

To then remove the error, simply delete the blank `.desktop` file created earlier (i.e. `test.desktop`).



### Expected behavior
Still been able to access the settings and even the 'Applications' tab, displaying the error inside the actual tab (e.g. overlaying the application list) nonetheless allowing users to be able to refresh the applications of their Qube directly through the GUI.
There could also be a benefit towards only having the complete application listing occur when the applications tab of that Qube's settings are opened, reducing unnecessary resource usage on each opening of a Qube's settings since far from every opening of a Qube's settings will see a user going to the 'Applications' tab.




### Actual behavior
The behaviour of the `qvm-appmenu` command listed above is that once it comes across a `.desktop` file which is incomplete, it exits with an error. 
This would not be a particular issue if it was not for the refresh applications feature creating `.desktop` files before actually populating them. 
When my system suddenly crashed while I was in the process of refreshing applications for one of my Qubes, when resolving the issue manually afterwards by deleting all of the blank `.desktop` files, I realised that I had been left with numerous blank `.desktop` files. They were all I believe new applications that were not previously listed in the application menu but nonetheless, there were multiple which were completely blank.

This behaviour from the applications refresh leaving multiple `.desktop` files as completely empty will then cause an issue in the listing of available applications performed by the `qvm-appmenus` file.

issue.title: `qvm-appmenus --remove` on dispvm templates leads to `xdg-desktop-menu` error

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: default
labels.description: Priority: default. Default priority for new issues, to be replaced given sufficient information.

labels.name: diagnosed
labels.description: Technical diagnosis has been performed (see issue comments).

labels.name: pr submitted
labels.description: A pull request has been submitted for this issue.

issue.body:
### Qubes OS release

R4.1 (4.1.1)

### Brief summary

`qvm-appmenus --remove` on dispvm templates errors out on a `xdg-desktop-menu` call.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a new AppVM, say `test-dvm`
2. `qvm-prefs test-dvm template_for_dispvms true`
3. `qvm-features test-dvm appmenus-dispvm 1`
4. `qvm-appmenus --create test-dvm`
5. `qvm-appmenus --remove test-dvm`

### Expected behavior

Appmenus for `test-dvm` are created and removed without errors.

### Actual behavior

Appmenus removal errors out:

```
xdg-desktop-menu: desktop-file argument missing
Try 'xdg-desktop-menu --help' for more information.
Problem removing appmenus for test-dvm
```

issue.title: Opening Qube Settings Fails Critically When Application Refreshes Interrupted

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: default
labels.description: Priority: default. Default priority for new issues, to be replaced given sufficient information.

labels.name: diagnosed
labels.description: Technical diagnosis has been performed (see issue comments).

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### Qubes OS release
4.1.1




### Brief summary
If the refresh of applications of a Qube is interrupted (e.g. a sudden power loss) while it is in progress, attempting to open the settings of a Qube fails with a critical error related to the execution of `qvm-appmenus`. 
Below is the resulting error for a Qube called 'yubico'.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58621925/181877311-4f62b013-af1b-412a-8d7a-8dc0dee82cf6.png)


This is caused by having `.desktop` files stored in that Qube's `apps.template` directory in Dom0 which are incomplete (e.g. don't have a name value).  Them being incomplete causes the `qvm-appmenus` command to fail. 

The exact behaviour is further elaborated in the 'Actual Behaviour' section below.


### Steps to reproduce
While this bug will only be caused by events which produce a sudden interruption of either the machine as a whole or the refresh applications feature, **it can be triggered manually.**

The issue being caused by non-complete `.desktop` files you can reproduce the error in the following way:
1. Open the terminal emulator in Dom0
2. Navigate to `~/.local/share/qubes-appmenus/QUBENAME/apps.template/`, replacing `QUBENAME` by the name of the Qube you want to test this out on.
3. Create a blank `.desktop` file (i.e. `touch test.desktop`).
4. Navigate to the Qube app menu and attempt to open the Qube settings for your Qube `QUBENAME`. 
5. This should trigger an identical crash.
6. **To trigger directly in the terminal with more details**, you can run the `qvm-appmenus` command listed which should be `qvm-appmenus --get-available QUBENAME --i-understand-format-is-unstable --file-filed QUBENAME`. However, you can also trigger the error with a much shorter version of the command: `qvm-appmenus --get-available QUBENAME --i-understand-format-is-unstable`

To then remove the error, simply delete the blank `.desktop` file created earlier (i.e. `test.desktop`).



### Expected behavior
Still been able to access the settings and even the 'Applications' tab, displaying the error inside the actual tab (e.g. overlaying the application list) nonetheless allowing users to be able to refresh the applications of their Qube directly through the GUI.
There could also be a benefit towards only having the complete application listing occur when the applications tab of that Qube's settings are opened, reducing unnecessary resource usage on each opening of a Qube's settings since far from every opening of a Qube's settings will see a user going to the 'Applications' tab.




### Actual behavior
The behaviour of the `qvm-appmenu` command listed above is that once it comes across a `.desktop` file which is incomplete, it exits with an error. 
This would not be a particular issue if it was not for the refresh applications feature creating `.desktop` files before actually populating them. 
When my system suddenly crashed while I was in the process of refreshing applications for one of my Qubes, when resolving the issue manually afterwards by deleting all of the blank `.desktop` files, I realised that I had been left with numerous blank `.desktop` files. They were all I believe new applications that were not previously listed in the application menu but nonetheless, there were multiple which were completely blank.

This behaviour from the applications refresh leaving multiple `.desktop` files as completely empty will then cause an issue in the listing of available applications performed by the `qvm-appmenus` file.

issue.title: `qvm-appmenus --remove` on dispvm templates leads to `xdg-desktop-menu` error

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: default
labels.description: Priority: default. Default priority for new issues, to be replaced given sufficient information.

labels.name: diagnosed
labels.description: Technical diagnosis has been performed (see issue comments).

labels.name: pr submitted
labels.description: A pull request has been submitted for this issue.

issue.body:
### Qubes OS release

R4.1 (4.1.1)

### Brief summary

`qvm-appmenus --remove` on dispvm templates errors out on a `xdg-desktop-menu` call.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a new AppVM, say `test-dvm`
2. `qvm-prefs test-dvm template_for_dispvms true`
3. `qvm-features test-dvm appmenus-dispvm 1`
4. `qvm-appmenus --create test-dvm`
5. `qvm-appmenus --remove test-dvm`

### Expected behavior

Appmenus for `test-dvm` are created and removed without errors.

### Actual behavior

Appmenus removal errors out:

```
xdg-desktop-menu: desktop-file argument missing
Try 'xdg-desktop-menu --help' for more information.
Problem removing appmenus for test-dvm
```

```

```

issue.title: Opening Qube Settings Fails Critically When Application Refreshes Interrupted

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: default
labels.description: Priority: default. Default priority for new issues, to be replaced given sufficient information.

labels.name: diagnosed
labels.description: Technical diagnosis has been performed (see issue comments).

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### Qubes OS release
4.1.1




### Brief summary
If the refresh of applications of a Qube is interrupted (e.g. a sudden power loss) while it is in progress, attempting to open the settings of a Qube fails with a critical error related to the execution of `qvm-appmenus`. 
Below is the resulting error for a Qube called 'yubico'.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58621925/181877311-4f62b013-af1b-412a-8d7a-8dc0dee82cf6.png)


This is caused by having `.desktop` files stored in that Qube's `apps.template` directory in Dom0 which are incomplete (e.g. don't have a name value).  Them being incomplete causes the `qvm-appmenus` command to fail. 

The exact behaviour is further elaborated in the 'Actual Behaviour' section below.


### Steps to reproduce
While this bug will only be caused by events which produce a sudden interruption of either the machine as a whole or the refresh applications feature, **it can be triggered manually.**

The issue being caused by non-complete `.desktop` files you can reproduce the error in the following way:
1. Open the terminal emulator in Dom0
2. Navigate to `~/.local/share/qubes-appmenus/QUBENAME/apps.template/`, replacing `QUBENAME` by the name of the Qube you want to test this out on.
3. Create a blank `.desktop` file (i.e. `touch test.desktop`).
4. Navigate to the Qube app menu and attempt to open the Qube settings for your Qube `QUBENAME`. 
5. This should trigger an identical crash.
6. **To trigger directly in the terminal with more details**, you can run the `qvm-appmenus` command listed which should be `qvm-appmenus --get-available QUBENAME --i-understand-format-is-unstable --file-filed QUBENAME`. However, you can also trigger the error with a much shorter version of the command: `qvm-appmenus --get-available QUBENAME --i-understand-format-is-unstable`

To then remove the error, simply delete the blank `.desktop` file created earlier (i.e. `test.desktop`).



### Expected behavior
Still been able to access the settings and even the 'Applications' tab, displaying the error inside the actual tab (e.g. overlaying the application list) nonetheless allowing users to be able to refresh the applications of their Qube directly through the GUI.
There could also be a benefit towards only having the complete application listing occur when the applications tab of that Qube's settings are opened, reducing unnecessary resource usage on each opening of a Qube's settings since far from every opening of a Qube's settings will see a user going to the 'Applications' tab.




### Actual behavior
The behaviour of the `qvm-appmenu` command listed above is that once it comes across a `.desktop` file which is incomplete, it exits with an error. 
This would not be a particular issue if it was not for the refresh applications feature creating `.desktop` files before actually populating them. 
When my system suddenly crashed while I was in the process of refreshing applications for one of my Qubes, when resolving the issue manually afterwards by deleting all of the blank `.desktop` files, I realised that I had been left with numerous blank `.desktop` files. They were all I believe new applications that were not previously listed in the application menu but nonetheless, there were multiple which were completely blank.

This behaviour from the applications refresh leaving multiple `.desktop` files as completely empty will then cause an issue in the listing of available applications performed by the `qvm-appmenus` file.

issue.title: `qvm-appmenus --remove` on dispvm templates leads to `xdg-desktop-menu` error

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: default
labels.description: Priority: default. Default priority for new issues, to be replaced given sufficient information.

labels.name: diagnosed
labels.description: Technical diagnosis has been performed (see issue comments).

labels.name: pr submitted
labels.description: A pull request has been submitted for this issue.

issue.body:
### Qubes OS release

R4.1 (4.1.1)

### Brief summary

`qvm-appmenus --remove` on dispvm templates errors out on a `xdg-desktop-menu` call.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a new AppVM, say `test-dvm`
2. `qvm-prefs test-dvm template_for_dispvms true`
3. `qvm-features test-dvm appmenus-dispvm 1`
4. `qvm-appmenus --create test-dvm`
5. `qvm-appmenus --remove test-dvm`

### Expected behavior

Appmenus for `test-dvm` are created and removed without errors.

### Actual behavior

Appmenus removal errors out:

```
xdg-desktop-menu: desktop-file argument missing
Try 'xdg-desktop-menu --help' for more information.
Problem removing appmenus for test-dvm
```

issue.title: Opening Qube Settings Fails Critically When Application Refreshes Interrupted

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: default
labels.description: Priority: default. Default priority for new issues, to be replaced given sufficient information.

labels.name: diagnosed
labels.description: Technical diagnosis has been performed (see issue comments).

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### Qubes OS release
4.1.1




### Brief summary
If the refresh of applications of a Qube is interrupted (e.g. a sudden power loss) while it is in progress, attempting to open the settings of a Qube fails with a critical error related to the execution of `qvm-appmenus`. 
Below is the resulting error for a Qube called 'yubico'.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58621925/181877311-4f62b013-af1b-412a-8d7a-8dc0dee82cf6.png)


This is caused by having `.desktop` files stored in that Qube's `apps.template` directory in Dom0 which are incomplete (e.g. don't have a name value).  Them being incomplete causes the `qvm-appmenus` command to fail. 

The exact behaviour is further elaborated in the 'Actual Behaviour' section below.


### Steps to reproduce
While this bug will only be caused by events which produce a sudden interruption of either the machine as a whole or the refresh applications feature, **it can be triggered manually.**

The issue being caused by non-complete `.desktop` files you can reproduce the error in the following way:
1. Open the terminal emulator in Dom0
2. Navigate to `~/.local/share/qubes-appmenus/QUBENAME/apps.template/`, replacing `QUBENAME` by the name of the Qube you want to test this out on.
3. Create a blank `.desktop` file (i.e. `touch test.desktop`).
4. Navigate to the Qube app menu and attempt to open the Qube settings for your Qube `QUBENAME`. 
5. This should trigger an identical crash.
6. **To trigger directly in the terminal with more details**, you can run the `qvm-appmenus` command listed which should be `qvm-appmenus --get-available QUBENAME --i-understand-format-is-unstable --file-filed QUBENAME`. However, you can also trigger the error with a much shorter version of the command: `qvm-appmenus --get-available QUBENAME --i-understand-format-is-unstable`

To then remove the error, simply delete the blank `.desktop` file created earlier (i.e. `test.desktop`).



### Expected behavior
Still been able to access the settings and even the 'Applications' tab, displaying the error inside the actual tab (e.g. overlaying the application list) nonetheless allowing users to be able to refresh the applications of their Qube directly through the GUI.
There could also be a benefit towards only having the complete application listing occur when the applications tab of that Qube's settings are opened, reducing unnecessary resource usage on each opening of a Qube's settings since far from every opening of a Qube's settings will see a user going to the 'Applications' tab.




### Actual behavior
The behaviour of the `qvm-appmenu` command listed above is that once it comes across a `.desktop` file which is incomplete, it exits with an error. 
This would not be a particular issue if it was not for the refresh applications feature creating `.desktop` files before actually populating them. 
When my system suddenly crashed while I was in the process of refreshing applications for one of my Qubes, when resolving the issue manually afterwards by deleting all of the blank `.desktop` files, I realised that I had been left with numerous blank `.desktop` files. They were all I believe new applications that were not previously listed in the application menu but nonetheless, there were multiple which were completely blank.

This behaviour from the applications refresh leaving multiple `.desktop` files as completely empty will then cause an issue in the listing of available applications performed by the `qvm-appmenus` file.

issue.title: `qvm-appmenus --remove` on dispvm templates leads to `xdg-desktop-menu` error

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: default
labels.description: Priority: default. Default priority for new issues, to be replaced given sufficient information.

labels.name: diagnosed
labels.description: Technical diagnosis has been performed (see issue comments).

labels.name: pr submitted
labels.description: A pull request has been submitted for this issue.

issue.body:
### Qubes OS release

R4.1 (4.1.1)

### Brief summary

`qvm-appmenus --remove` on dispvm templates errors out on a `xdg-desktop-menu` call.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a new AppVM, say `test-dvm`
2. `qvm-prefs test-dvm template_for_dispvms true`
3. `qvm-features test-dvm appmenus-dispvm 1`
4. `qvm-appmenus --create test-dvm`
5. `qvm-appmenus --remove test-dvm`

### Expected behavior

Appmenus for `test-dvm` are created and removed without errors.

### Actual behavior

Appmenus removal errors out:

```
xdg-desktop-menu: desktop-file argument missing
Try 'xdg-desktop-menu --help' for more information.
Problem removing appmenus for test-dvm
```
